history.content:
"For example, if you have completed 130 or fewer units at the end of your eighth semester, you may enroll in the following semester in as many units as you want. But, if you have 130.1 units, you may not enroll again, and your registration will be blocked"

- https://ls.berkeley.edu/advising/planning/enrolling/unit-ceiling.

Also, note that the unit cap only applies if you are trying to go past eight semesters (or nine, for a double major).

Yes, the course-overlap restriction is separate per pair of major/minor.

children.subject: Oops. I forgot that I asked the same one. xp

So for your second answer, I can fulfill three courses in (let's say DS) with 2 from Stat and 1 from CS, right?

Thank you again!

history.content:
So according to the policy, our unit cap is 130. So for example, if my cumulative units on fall semester is 130 which didn't exceed the unit cap, could I take one more semester over 130 units? or it should be at most 129 units to take one more semester exceeding the cap.

Also if I'm trying to double major(DS, Stat) and one minor(CS), could I use one course from minor to fulfill one course in DS and use two courses from Stat to fulfill another two courses in DS? So DS will be sharing total of three courses but don't use more than 2 courses with Stat major and only one course with CS.
history.subject: Is it possible to take 130 units on one semester and take next semester again?

history.content: So according to the policy, our unit cap is 130. So for example, if my cumulative units on fall semester is 130 which didn't exceed the unit cap, could I take one more semester over 130 units? or it should be at most 129 units to take one more semester exceeding the cap
history.subject: Is it possible to take 130 units on one semester and take next semester again?
